block.p: 4 Charged in Bomb Plot At Kennedy Airport Four men, including a onetime cargo handler at Kennedy International Airport and a former member of the Guyanese Parliament, were charged with plotting to blow up fuel tanks, terminal buildings and fuel lines beneath the airport. Officials said there was no imminent danger because the suspects had no detailed plans, financing or explosives.

U.S. Forces Strike in Somalia American forces shelled an area on Somalia's northern coast thought to be a hide-out for Islamic militants. It was the third United States strike inside the country this year.

Golf's Mr. Unpredictable Play, The New York Times sports magazine, looks at Phil Mickelson, who always leaves fans wondering: Is the knucklehead going to emerge? Also, the gloomy career arc of the Chicago Cubs' pitcher Kerry Wood, and high life on the high seas at the America's Cup.

A Setback for Clemens The Yankees' injury-riddled season took another bad turn: Roger Clemens's return has been pushed back at least a few days because of a sore groin. Also, the Yankees lost at Boston, 11-6.
Presidential Shortcomings Frank Rich on why President George W. Bush is no Richard M. Nixon.
